diff_hunk:
@@ -45,11 +45,9 @@
 VALIDATION_FILE = 'validation.tfrecords'
 
 
-def read_and_decode(filename_queue):
-  reader = tf.TFRecordReader()
-  _, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)
-  features = tf.parse_single_example(
-      serialized_example,
+def decode(serialized_example):
+  features = tf.parse_example(
body:
I stumbled upon #390 . I wasn't sure if it was still relevant so I tried both versions and on my machine `parse_example` was slightly faster. Another thought was to do `dataset = dataset.batch(...)` before the parsing. Although, I haven't tested it so can't say if it is better.

If it is easier to read via `tf.parse_single_example` I'll happily revert the change. After all the focus here is readability over performance.

If it is easier to read via tf.parse_single_example I'll happily revert the change. After all the focus here is readability over performance.
body_text:
I stumbled upon #390 . I wasn't sure if it was still relevant so I tried both versions and on my machine parse_example was slightly faster. Another thought was to do dataset = dataset.batch(...) before the parsing. Although, I haven't tested it so can't say if it is better.
If it is easier to read via tf.parse_single_example I'll happily revert the change. After all the focus here is readability over performance.
